Articles.Content:
and introducing K-SEE News reporter and model, Kim Kerman:

So the April O' Neil of the Kerbal Universe? Just without the mutant ninja turtles, and with aliens with mutant piloting and crashing skills.

The copter looks awesome btw
MY EYES, OMG that is pretty sick can't wait to fly it.

Walk around, Kerbodyne Gyronautics Kerbostar

-Tail will be separate.

-Tail Rotor separate part.

-Turbax Turboshaft and Main Rotor all one part.

-Fuselage separate part.

-Skids separate part.

-Not shown: Spotlight and Dome Camera.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

and introducing K-SEE News reporter and model, Kim Kerman:

-Kim K. will be released as a PSD kit similar to the KSO Patch Kit allowing folks to recolor, repost, change her hair, use her as pinup art for the side of their aircraft, etcetera. In the meantime you are free to use the above png in your signatures, edit it, repost it, do as you wish

The pinup artwork on the side of the fuse was inspired by the "Lilymarie"; http://img11.hostingpics.net/pics/5222039501.jpg

That is beyond anything I could imagine. Its really beautiful I mean based on everything else I shouldn't be surprised but damn you still manage to surprise me.

That kerbostar is looking great.I am very much looking forward to seeing it in-game. Great work and nice pinup kerbal.

Edited July 16, 2014 by qnistNAMEERF

Those helos (and their texture packs) are smokin', helldiver.

Have you considered using JSITransparentPod to make the windscreens and windows see-through?

I had gotten way too distracted with the ET and SRBs that I had forgotten about the OMS engines, they have been put back on for a while now.

Front flipping.

How did you get the FASA towers to work? Mine pull away from the shuttle immediately on loading.

How did you get the FASA towers to work? Mine pull away from the shuttle immediately on loading.

Mine just work...

That looks great helldiver! Can't wait to see it in game.

Mine just work...

Damn. Well let me know when you release that beanie cap!
The chopper looks great, helldiver!
I like the chopper! It'll come in handy when 0.24 comes out for hauling items back to KSC (with KAS) so I can recover them for maximum value!
Has anyone had success landing the EWBCL with FAR installed, at low speeds I find the craft neigh uncontrollable, at least using the FAR fix provided a while back.

Has anyone had success landing the EWBCL with FAR installed, at low speeds I find the craft neigh uncontrollable, at least using the FAR fix provided a while back.

Not yet. I have stumbled upon a problem with the FAR config though - despite moving the attach nodes outside of the body the wings still show as shielded, resulting in a CoL far aft of where it should be and much less lift than it should have. This would explain the high velocities needed for any control, and the fact that it falls like the proverbial brick when supersonic.

The pinup artwork on the side of the fuse was inspired by the "Lilymarie"; http://img11.hostingpics.net/pics/5222039501.jpg

PLS make a medical livery for the helicopter so we use it when an unlucky shuttle crashes.

Has anyone had success landing the EWBCL with FAR installed, at low speeds I find the craft neigh uncontrollable, at least using the FAR fix provided a while back.

Check if the configuration has a MassOffset anywhere in it. The first one I posted was without that, it was impossible to land. If it does, how low of a speed are you talking about? I wouldn't set it down at anything less than 100 m/s.

Not yet. I have stumbled upon a problem with the FAR config though - despite moving the attach nodes outside of the body the wings still show as shielded, resulting in a CoL far aft of where it should be and much less lift than it should have. This would explain the high velocities needed for any control, and the fact that it falls like the proverbial brick when supersonic.

I thought I'd gotten that behavior under control, at least outside the VAB. But FAR really doesn't like this cargo bay.

How did you get the FASA towers to work? Mine pull away from the shuttle immediately on loading.

Ditto on this... I'd imagine it's got something to do with another mod you're using. Mine does the same thing, and judging by your video's I've got a lot of the same mods as you do. If you (or anybody else) gets some insight on this, I'd love to hear it.

Will be streaming today at 6:00pm PST, http://www.twitch.tv/fanbus

-Please keep in mind this is not a game stream.

-I will not be playing KSP

-Feel free to ask any KSOS related question.

-Will be working on Phase IV

Edited July 17, 2014 by AppleDavidJeans
Wrong quote

PLS make a medical livery for the helicopter so we use it when an unlucky shuttle crashes.

NO SPACE BOOBS. Kerbal females should not be sexually attractive to humans. Either http://i.imgur.com/Nux3eGvh.jpg?1 or http://vladoportos.sk/wp-content/uploads/odyssey2desktop.png are good.

KSPTV's resident female streamer would most agree with the latter.

Edited July 17, 2014 by GregroxMun
Even on Kerbin, mega corporations manipulate the public and the self image of large-foreheaded kerbal females suffers. Here's that model next to some photos of non-airbrushed kerbals:
Even on Kerbin, mega corporations manipulate the public and the self image of large-foreheaded kerbal females suffers. Here's that model next to some photos of non-airbrushed kerbals:
Why? It's not even uncanny valley type stuff.

Even on Kerbin, mega corporations manipulate the public and the self image of large-foreheaded kerbal females suffers. Here's that model next to some photos of non-airbrushed kerbals:

Head is too small, and amphibianoids don't have boobs. Not even most mammals have any boobs. My Kerbals don't objectify women anyway, so I won't be using pinup Kerbals on my copters.

Not even most mammals have any boobs.

By definition, wouldn't all mammals have functioning mammaries?

By definition, wouldn't all mammals have functioning mammaries?

Boobs. I mean large round fat-filled sacks, of course they'd have mammary glands.

Let's not go all Female-Kerbal argument here or the thread will be locked.
